definition: to depend on sth for existence/dependent on
to depend on/to comply with or listen to sb/according to/in the light of
to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive

pinyin: gai4 nian4 yi1 cun2 mo2 xing2

sentences.english: It is awfully easy to forget about the interaction and codependence of different data.
sentences.chinese: 非常容易忘記不同數據間的相互作用和互相依存。

sentences.english: The two countries are becoming increasingly interdependent and are closely connected with each other in their future development.
sentences.chinese: 俄中相互依存日益緊密，發展前途密切相關。

sentences.english: Then so-called common will turn into depending on each other.
sentences.chinese: 然後所謂永遠，有一天又會變成相互依存。

sentences.english: Objective To study the effects of the field-dependent cognitive style on optokinetic illusion.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討場依存性認知方式對視動性錯覺的影響。

sentences.english: “Our relationship with Earth is one of mutual interdependence, ” he added.
sentences.chinese: “我們與地球是相互依存的關係”，他評價道。

sentences.english: Any long-term antagonistic relationship seemed to harbor this kind of codependency.
sentences.chinese: 任何長期敵對的關係似乎都包容這樣的相互依存。

sentences.english: Theexperiment shows that cognitive style of on-campus students is mainly field dependent.
sentences.chinese: 實驗證明，高職學生認知風格以場依存性風格爲主。

sentences.english: The financial crisis has shown the downside of global inter-dependence.
sentences.chinese: 金融危機顯示出全球相互依存的經濟下滑趨勢。

sentences.english: However in the securities market of Hong Kong is opposite, the stock trend is independence, and the perfonnance compares dispersion.
sentences.chinese: 而香港證券市場依存度較低，股票走勢相對獨立。

sentences.english: Can we differentiate between interdependence and co-dependence?
sentences.chinese: 我們是否能夠區別相互依存和相互依賴？

sentences.english: Mutual interdependence brings neighbors back together and re-weaves the societal web.
sentences.chinese: 相互依存帶來的鄰居一起回來並重新編織社會網絡。

sentences.english: It 's a tale of perfect camaraderie and of co-dependence.
sentences.chinese: 這個故事代表着完美的友誼和相互依存的關係。

sentences.english: All the many skills a young child learns are inter-related and dependent on each other.
sentences.chinese: 所有幼兒學習的許多技能都是互相關聯，互相依存的。

sentences.english: And luxury lies not in richness and ornateness but in the absence of vulgarity .
sentences.chinese: 奢華並不依存於闊綽和華麗，而是顯現在不粗俗之中。

sentences.english: In contrast, East Asian cultures stress interdependence.
sentences.chinese: 相反，東亞文化強調相互依存。

sentences.english: School education and the national culture are inter-dependent and mutually-promoting.
sentences.chinese: 學校教育與民族文化相互依存，相互促進。

definition: to construct (often sth abstract, such as good relations)/to set up/to develop/construction (abstract)/architecture
to share the same interests (idiom)/to be closely related/to be in the same boat
to maintain/to keep up/to hold together
